name: v10.3.0
body: * GradleRunner: add gradle-enterprise-test-distribution-agent-workspace folder

name: v10.2.0
body: Upgrade to Spock 2.1-M2

name: v10.1.0
body: Gradle 7.2

name: v10.0.0-rc.1
body: Gradle 7 compatibility with Spock 2.0

name: v10.0.0
body: Breaking change: Gradle 7 compatibility with Spock 2.0. This release is only compatible with Gradle 7 and forward due to the usage of Spock 2.0 with Groovy 3

name: v9.0.0
body:
Remove transitive dependencies on `guava` and commons-io`. `cglib-nodeb` and `objenesis` moved to `runtime` scope.

This can be breaking change if you are defining custom classpath filters for runners. The API used to be `com.google.common.base.Predicate` now it is `java.util.function.Predicate`

name: v8.2.0
body: Add ability to specify Gradle version which should be used for generating repositories with dummy dependencies.

name: v9.0.0-rc.3
body: Avoid adding testing frameworks into classpaths of project under test. It helps to avoid conflicts between Spock 2.x and old groovy if older Gradle version is specified in a test.

name: v9.0.0-rc.2
body: Additional handling of deprecations scenarios in Gradle 7

name: v9.0.0-rc.1
body: `nebula-test` migrated to Gradle 7 introducing Groovy 3. This major version will not work with projects using Gradle 6.x or less.

name: v8.1.0
body: This version reverts previous feature to the state of the version `7.10.2` We discovered that there are problems in intended backward compatibility with Gradle 6.

name: v8.0.0
body: Add groovy3 feature variant to allow parallel support for Gradle 6 and Gradle 7. How to use the variant is documented [here](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/nebula-test/wiki#depending-on-nebula-test)

name: v8.0.0-rc.1
body: Add `groovy3` feature variant to allow parallel support for Gradle 6 and Gradle 7.

name: v7.10.2
body: Fix ability to discover plugin under test dependencies when using`mavenLocal()`

name: v7.10.1
body: Rerelease of `7.10.0` due to publishing issues.

name: v7.10.0
body: Don't use `compile` configuration in dependencies generator to ensure compatibility with Gradle 7.0.

name: v7.9.4
body: * `GradleRunner`: `CLASSPATH_GRADLE_CACHE` should account for `GRADLE_RO_DEP_CACHE` environment variable presence

name: v7.9.2
body: - Add classpath init script to the build arguments first so `initScripts` added by plugins can depend on the already configured classpath

name: v7.9.1
body: * maintenance release

name: v7.9.0
body: * explicitly `disconnect` Gradle connector after test is executed

name: v7.8.6
body: `checkForDeprecations` looks for a additional deprecation message

name: v7.8.5
body:
Ensure that the trait IntegrationTestKitBase has a different cleanup method

To avoid the error: 'The method setup should be public as it implements the corresponding method from interface...'

name: v7.8.4
body: make apache.commons `api` scope

name: v7.8.1
body: Spock dependency was in incorrect scope. It is not `implementation` but `api` dependency. It would cause compilation failures for consumers.

name: v7.8.0
body: Decoupling helper functions for creating tests from Spock Framework. Thank you @dansanduleac

name: v7.7.0
body: Add parallel mode option to BaseIntegrationSpec

name: v7.6.0
body:
Default to not using `GradleRunner.forwardOutput()` which forwards the output of executed builds to the System.out stream. (This behavior can be enabled again via setting `forwardOutput` for `IntegrationTestKitSpec`)

With `forwardOutput` enabled, each test and its console output print to the System.out stream with the indicator STANDARD_OUT

### Using

Gradle 6.0.1

name: v7.5.0
body: When you are using Gradle 6 in tests. Dependency generator API will start automatically publishing Gradle metadata. DSL for creating dummy dependencies will allow now specify `targetCompatibility` for those dummy libraries.

name: v7.4.0
body: Update dependency on Spock to bring the most recent version `1.3-groovy-2.4`

name: v7.3.0
body: Generate `maven-metadata.xml` for repositories for testing to fully support Gradle 6 which will require them for dynamic version resolution.

name: v7.2.1
body: Generate `settings.gradle` in projects generated by TestKit parent class. It allows use them with Gradle 5.

name: v7.2.0
body:
Add more methods to generate code for projects created within tests.
Add ability to run TestKit based tests with specific Gradle or specific Gradle distribution
Add ability to run TestKit based tests with plugins outside `plugins` block

name: v7.1.9
body:
Added support for old versions of gradle layout pattern in ivy repos. Reported in https://github.com/nebula-plugins/nebula-test/issues/108 

`patternLayout` was introduced on Gradle 5 and breaks old consumers of this library.

This change introduces two new constructors for `GradleDependencyGenerator`:

`GradleDependencyGenerator(Gradle gradle, DependencyGraph graph, String directory = 'build/testrepogen')`

and 

`GradleDependencyGenerator(String gradleVersion, DependencyGraph graph, String directory = 'build/testrepogen')`

This way a version of Gradle could be passed and the generator is now aware on how to generate the pattern layout block accordingly

name: v7.1.8
body: Use HTTPS for repositories

name: v7.1.6
body: Allow configuring LogLevel on integration tests via `NEBULA_TEST_LOGGING_LEVEL` env. variable

name: v7.1.5
body: Fix how we create a dependency graph when status is not provided via builder

name: v7.1.4
body: Enabled deprecation warning failures

name: v7.1.3
body: Rollback change around failing with deprecation warnings due to 3rd party libraries potentially breaking a lot of tests

name: v7.1.2
body: * Use `IvyArtifactRepository.patternLayout(Action)` instead of the deprecated `IvyArtifactRepository.layout(String, Closure)`

name: v7.1.1
body: Added more potential output for gradle deprecations

name: v7.1.0
body: Upgrade to release plugin with groovy 2.5 support and add proper immutable configuration for Dependency classes

Breaking changes
===

Support only for Gradle 4.0+

name: v6.7.1
body:
Gradle 4.9 compatibility

Switch from `org.gradle.tooling.ProgressListener` to `org.gradle.tooling.events.ProgressListener` for tracking executed tasks.

name: v6.5.0
body: Configure the Gradle user home to the `.gradle` directory in the test directory for `IntegationSpec` based tests. Sharing a single user home causes test determinism issues and significantly impacts the performance of parallel tests.

name: v6.4.5
body: Ignore 'dependencyInsight' warning for now. If this is the only warning present, it will not fail the build.

name: v6.4.4
body: Set warning mode through system property passed through command line instead of creating a gradle.properties file.

name: v6.4.3
body: * Do Not Reference Subproject Variable in Root in generated multiprojects

name: v6.3.0
body:
* Improve `IntegrationTestKitSpec` to handle different levels of logging.
* Add some more helpers to `IntegrationTestKitSpec`
* Add a `runTasksAndFail` task to `IntegrationTestKitSpec`

name: v6.2.0
body: You can specify a custom status for each dependency when you are building dependencies graph in your tests. You can find more details [here](https://github.com/nebula-plugins/nebula-test/wiki/Maven-and-Ivy-Repository-Generation#create-an-ivy-dependency-with-specific-status)

name: v6.1.2
body: Improve classpath filtering so IntelliJ `out` directories are included for launch configurations. Avoids `ClassNotFoundExceptions` on IntelliJ 2017.2 where the test launch configuration has the working directory as the module root, rather than the project root.

name: v6.1.1
body: Fix Groovy compilation error when TestKit isn't available on the classpath

name: v6.1.0
body: Check for Gradle deprecations at the end of a build. Add an `ignoreDeprecations` system property for the duration of the test to ignore deprecations

name: v6.0.0
body: Upgrade to Spock 1.1-rc-4

name: v5.1.3
body: IntegrationTestKitSpec fix for multiple subprojects

name: v5.1.1
body: Tweak on how to use IntegrationTestKitSpec

name: v5.1.0
body: Add a base class and helper for Gradle TestKit style integration tests.

name: v5.0.1
body:
# 5.0.1 / 2017-02-14
- BUGFIX: Fixes for Windows users
  - Thanks Björn Kautler github: Vampire
  - Thanks Willie Slepecki github: scphantm

name: v5.0.0
body: Compatibility with Gradle 3.3

name: v4.4.3
body: Gradle 3.3 Support

body: - Fix maven bom generation

body: - Fix classpath issue with project deps (from cli)

body: - Add project deps to IntegrationSpec path

name: v4.3.0
body: - Add bom generation

name: v4.2.2
body: Avoid using Gradle wrapper APIs for compatibility with Gradle 3.0

name: v4.2.1
body: Fix classpath filtering issues on Windows. Thank you to @lavcraft for the contribution!

name: v4.2.0
body: Add objenesis for Spock

name: v4.1.0
body: Compatibility with Gradle 2.14

name: v4.0.0
body: Compatibility with Gradle 2.8

name: v3.1.0
body:
- Support for init scripts
- Support for pre-build actions
